page.title: 06Landscape and Buildings
page.content:
whose workers the cottages were built
There is also a large residential caravan site with 66 mobile homes. The River Teign runs through the village and enters the sea at Teignmouth.Surrounding the village is heathland and farmland.The names of the housing estates are taken from these areas e.g. Teign View and Devon Heath. There is a regular bus service into Newton Abbot,Exeter and Plymouth which makes Chudleigh Knighton a very convenient place to live. {The Village Church It is called St.Pauls.It was built in 1841 and is the only church built of flint fiscs.It is quite small.It has one bell.The services are held by Father Pease whose parish church is St John's Bovey Tracey.
